com.st.st25pc.model.readers.st

Class STReaderTransceiveImplementation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.st.st25pc.model.readers.st.STReaderTransceiveImplementation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.st.st25sdk.RFReaderInterface

    public class STReaderTransceiveImplementation
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.st.st25sdk.RFReaderInterface
    Reader class to handle CR95HF and ST25R3911B-Disco and ST25R3916-Disco commands

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.st.st25sdk.RFReaderInterface

      • transceive

        public byte[] transceive(java.lang.Object obj,
                         java.lang.String commandName,
                         byte[] data)
                  throws com.st.st25sdk.STException
        Description copied from interface: com.st.st25sdk.RFReaderInterface
        Sends a command to the RF reader, and get the tag's response
        Specified by:
        transceive in interface com.st.st25sdk.RFReaderInterface
        Parameters:
        obj - object shared between the application and the reader implementation
        commandName - commandName
        data - data to transceive
        Returns:
        the tag's response
        Throws:
        com.st.st25sdk.STException - When the reader is in EVAL mode, the transceive() method must throw a TRANSCEIVE_EVAL_MODE STException along with the frame associated to the command

      • inventory

        public java.util.List<byte[]> inventory(com.st.st25sdk.RFReaderInterface.InventoryMode mode)
                                 throws com.st.st25sdk.STException
        Description copied from interface: com.st.st25sdk.RFReaderInterface
        Returns a list of detected tags. Each byte array in the list is in the LSByte-first order. Example: element {0xF0, 0xC8, 0xD6, 0x01, 0x04, 0x26, 0x02, 0xE0} for UID = E002260401D6C8F0
        Specified by:
        inventory in interface com.st.st25sdk.RFReaderInterface
        Parameters:
        mode - allows the reader to switch between different ISO/NFC standards such as NFC Type 4 or NFC Type 5
        Returns:
        List of current detected tag UIDs
        Throws:
        com.st.st25sdk.STException

      • setTransceiveMode

        public void setTransceiveMode(com.st.st25sdk.RFReaderInterface.TransceiveMode mode)
        Description copied from interface: com.st.st25sdk.RFReaderInterface
        Sets transceive to the specified mode
        Specified by:
        setTransceiveMode in interface com.st.st25sdk.RFReaderInterface
        Parameters:
        mode - The Transceive mode - NORMAL: Send RF command and returns data from tag - EVAL: the transceive command will throw a TRANSCEIVE_EVAL_MODE STException and set data corresponding to the frame sent by the reader - RECORD: the transceive command will be executed and the data corresponding to the frame sent by the reader is saved

      • getTransceiveMode

        public com.st.st25sdk.RFReaderInterface.TransceiveMode getTransceiveMode()
        Description copied from interface: com.st.st25sdk.RFReaderInterface
        Returns the current TransceiveMode
        Specified by:
        getTransceiveMode in interface com.st.st25sdk.RFReaderInterface
        Returns:
        current reader's transceive mode

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the list of commands that have been sent since the was set to RECORD

      • setTagResponseLengthInBytes

        public void setTagResponseLengthInBytes(int responseDataBytesNumber)
        Description copied from interface: com.st.st25sdk.RFReaderInterface
        Sets the size in bytes of the RF frame expected from the tag. This value is needed for some readers on specific commands. Once the RF command is sent, this length value will be reset to zero.
        Specified by:
        setTagResponseLengthInBytes in interface com.st.st25sdk.RFReaderInterface
        Parameters:
        responseDataBytesNumber - size of the response expected from the tag
